title: NDP leadership candidate Avi Lewis goes after AI data centres
description: NDP leadership candidate Avi Lewis is calling for a moratorium on data centres along with other measures in a bid to rein in emerging generative artificial intelligence (AI) companies that he says are stealing private data, threatening jobs and harming the environment.

title: X has submitted proof of remedial action over Grok misuse, says Fahmi
description: PUTRAJAYA: Social media platform X has submitted all required documentation to authorities to verify the remedial actions it has taken following public complaints over the misuse of its Grok artificial intelligence (AI) tool to generate and edit obscene content, says Datuk Fahmi Fadzil.

title: ‘Truth is incredibly important’: Jimmy Wales says trust matters more than AI for Wikipedia
description: JLF 2026 | Wales spoke at length about political criticism, declining trust, neutrality in an age of noise, and the growing temptation to outsource knowledge to artificial intelligence.
content:
“For the whole life of Wikipedia, there is always some noise and controversy and all this,” he said. “The main way we handle it is just stick to our work.”

title: South Korean law to regulate AI takes effect
description: South Korea became the first country to have a wide-ranging law regulating artificial intelligence take full effect on Jan 22, including specific provisions targeting deepfakes.
content:
SEOUL: South Korea became the first country to have a wide-ranging law regulating artificial intelligence take full effect on Jan 22, including specific provisions targeting deepfakes.

title: China's Small Data AI Gains Edge in Manufacturing, as Industry Experts Debate U.S.-China AI Competition
description: GUANGZHOU, China, Jan. 22, 2026 /PRNewswire/ -- Insights emerging from a recent industrial AI forum, where Dayin Technology participated alongside leading experts, have brought renewed focus to the deepening divergence in U.S.-China artificial intelligence development. As the global race for AI dominance intensifies, China is carving out a distinct lead in one critical arena: the integration of AI with industrial manufacturing. This is propelled by a clear national strategy. While the U.S. pours vast resources into AIGC (AI-Generated Content) and foundational model research, China is executing a determined, policy-driven push for 'AI+Industrial Manufacturing.' The result is a pivotal divergence: as the U.S. explores AI's creative frontiers, China is systematically deploying it to solidify its position as the world's workshop.
content: GUANGZHOU, China, Jan. 22, 2026 /PRNewswire/ -- Insights emerging from a recent industrial AI forum, where Dayin Technology participated alongside leading experts, have brought renewed focus to the deepening divergence in U.S.-China artificial intell... [4518 chars]
